sources.title: The Atomic Man
sources.description: A man is fished out of a river and taken to a hospital where he briefly dies. After he revives, it's discovered that he is a nuclear research scientist, has been contaminated with radioactive material, and is oddly uncommunicative. A reporter investigates, and with the help of the scientist's doctor and the police, uncovers a plot to destroy the scientist's work as well as part of London. Stars: Gene Nelson, Faith Domergue, Joseph Tomelty, Donald Gray, Vic Perry, Paul Hardtmuth, Martin Wyldeck, and Peter Arne IMDb Page The movie contains a 1955 copyright notice. This copyright was not renewed.

sources.title: The Atomic Man (1955)
sources.description: "The Atomic Man" is a 1955 science fiction film set against the backdrop of atomic experimentation during the Cold War. The story revolves around the character of a scientist named Dr. Paul Adams, who becomes involved in a series of mysterious atomic-related murders.

metadata.Plot: An atomic scientist is found floating in a river with a bullet in his back and a radioactive halo around his body. The radioactivity has put him seven-and-a-half seconds ahead of us in time. He teams up with a reporter to stop his evil double from destroying his experiments in artificial tungsten.
metadata.Actors: Gene Nelson, Faith Domergue, Joseph Tomelty
